i would label this sentence as [2] slightly relevant in determining what is right and wrong.

the level of respect shown to authority figures can be an important consideration in certain situations, but it's not necessarily a direct indicator of moral rightness or wrongness. there may be cases where respecting authority is the morally correct thing to do (e.g., following laws that protect public safety), but there are also instances where challenging authority is necessary to stand up for what is right (e.g., whistleblowing on unethical behavior).
